goal: Learn Natural Language Processing (NLP) skills within 4 months

milestones.title: Research and Planning
milestones.description: Gather information about NLP, identify key concepts, and create a learning plan

tasks.description: Conduct online research on NLP basics, including text processing, sentiment analysis, and machine learning
Create a list of key concepts and topics to focus on during the 4-month learning period
Develop a personalized learning plan, including goals, objectives, and timelines for each milestone

milestones.title: Foundational Knowledge
milestones.description: Gain a solid understanding of NLP fundamentals, including programming languages and tools

tasks.description: Learn the basics of Python programming language, focusing on data structures, functions, and object-oriented programming
Familiarize yourself with popular NLP libraries and tools, such as NLTK, spaCy, and gensim
Study the basics of machine learning, including supervised and unsupervised learning, regression, classification, and clustering

milestones.title: Text Processing and Analysis
milestones.description: Develop skills in text processing, tokenization, stemming, lemmatization, and sentiment analysis

tasks.description: Implement text preprocessing techniques, including tokenization, stopword removal, and stemming using NLTK or spaCy
Learn to perform sentiment analysis using machine learning algorithms, such as Naive Bayes or Support Vector Machines
Practice text classification and topic modeling using popular libraries like scikit-learn and Gensim

milestones.title: Advanced Topics and Applications
milestones.description: Explore advanced NLP topics, such as machine translation, question answering, and dialogue systems

tasks.description: Study machine translation techniques, including sequence-to-sequence models and attention mechanisms
Learn to build a simple question answering system using information retrieval and natural language processing techniques
Practice building a basic dialogue system using machine learning algorithms and NLP libraries like spaCy or NLTK
